intro: Folianthera guianensis, commonly known as the Guianan folianthera, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows as an understory plant, thriving in humid and shaded environments. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often have a velvety texture.
